name: Aid from Luxembourg
title: Minimal Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2021, Mexico received one of the lowest net bilateral aid flows from Luxembourg, amounting to just $9,999.99. This indicates limited financial support from this particular DAC donor.

name: Financial Outflows
title: Significant Financial Outflows
description: In 2023, Mexico experienced substantial net financial outflows, with $1.21 billion from IBRD, $1.83 billion from multilateral sources, $1.74 billion from official creditors, and $525.9 million from RDB nonconcessional sources. These figures highlight a significant financial drain from the country.

name: Export Taxation
title: Negligible Export Taxation
description: In 2022, taxes on exports contributed a minuscule 0.0000013% to Mexico's tax revenue, indicating a negligible reliance on export taxation as a revenue source.

name: Arms Exporter
title: Modest Arms Exporter
description: In 2019, Mexico's arms exports were valued at $1 million, reflecting a modest presence in the global arms market.

name: Political Stability
title: Stable Political Environment
description: In 2023, Mexico had a political stability score with 9 sources and a standard error of 0.205, suggesting a relatively stable political environment with low volatility.

name: Women's Unpaid Work
title: High Female Unpaid Workload
description: In 2019, Mexican women spent 27.77% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, highlighting a significant gender disparity in unpaid labor.

name: Child Health
title: Effective Diarrhea Treatment
description: In 2015, 79.9% of Mexican children under 5 received oral rehydration and continued feeding for diarrhea treatment, indicating effective healthcare practices for this condition.
